title: Princess Diana is a vision in pink as The Crown reimagines royal trip Down Under

Emma Corrin was a royally good replica for The Crown's Princess Diana.

The actress, 23, was the spitting image of the late princess as she filmed the fourth season of The Crown, in Malaga, on Sunday.

Series four will take fans back to the 1983 royal tour of Australia and bosses have recreated a string of Diana's most iconic looks for the show.

Emma turned heads in a bright pink dress which was made in the likeness of Lady Di's Donald Campbell number.

During the 1983 tour, the princess had worn the vivid dress on a visit to the Princess of Wales Wing at Fremantle Hospital in Perth, Western Australia.

(Image: Zuma Press / eyevine)

The Crown bosses had nailed Diana's look down to the very same white envelope-style handbag and pink hat.

All eyes were on Emma as she filmed with a statement orchid necklace hanging around her neck.

She joined the great and the good of The Crown's star-studded cast to shoot scenes for the fourth series of the show.

(Image: Tim Graham Photo Library via Get)

The latest instalment of the show will cover the "happy" courtship and marriage of Diana and Prince Charles (Josh O’Connor) until 1986.

In April, Emma admitted it was a dream to have landed the envy-inducing part of Diana in the lavish series.

She said: "I have been glued to the show and to think I'm now joining this incredibly talented acting family is surreal.

(Image: Zuma Press / eyevine)

"Princess Diana was an icon and her effect on the world remains profound and inspiring.

"To explore her through Peter Morgan's writing is the most exceptional opportunity and I will strive to do her justice!"

Insiders of the Netflix mega-hit series say the British actress is the "double" of Lady Di in the early 80s when she first started dating Prince Charles.

(Image: Getty Images)

The Crown creator Peter Morgan said of Emma: "Emma is a brilliant talent who immediately captivated us when she came in for the part of Diana Spencer.

"As well as having the innocence and beauty of a young Diana, she also has, in abundance, the range and complexity to portray an extraordinary woman who went from anonymous teenager to becoming the most iconic woman of her generation."

The third series, which will be available to fans this weekend, will feature Charles in his 20s.

The Crown bosses controversially chose to change their cast members rather than age the actors and actresses.

In the third series, Olivia Coleman transforms into Queen Elizabeth II as she takes on the baton from Claire Foy.

Helena Bonham Carter takes on the role of Princess Margaret from Vanessa Kirby.
